result.execSummary:
The defendant Bee Khang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessments/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  DNA sample. 

Court REMITS all courts costs/DNA surcharge.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Becky.
Case Called: 4:01 pm
State appears by ADA D Toldt; Def appears with Atty Pauline Toulouse.  
Parties state agreement has not been reached. 
Atty Toulouse states deft is requesting she withdraw as counsel as deft wishes to represent himself.
Deft questions court regarding charges.
COURT: Atty Toulouse to remain on case and provide stand by counsel.
Atty Toulouse makes argument and requests to withdraw.
COURT denies.
32 jurors to be called in for 1 day jury trial.
MIL and JI 1 week before trial.
Atty Toulouse to provide copies of all documents to deft for jury trial; Atty Toldt to copy in Atty Toulouse and Deft with all future filings.
Deft wishes to adjourn jury trial;
COURT denies.
Deft's address: 540 S 3rd Ave. Wausau, WI 54401
Adj: 4:09 pm
